abstract: Muslims on Twitter respond to call from Islamic State group leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi for Muslims to fight on group's behalf with sarcasm and defiance; Twitter response is apparently led by Arab Spring activist Iyad El-Badghdadi of United Arab Emirates, who now lives in Norway.
lead_paragraph: Play video games, see “Star Wars,” wash the dishes: Muslims respond to the Islamic State leader’s rallying cry with defiance, opposition and sarcasm.

headline.main: Muslims on Twitter Say They Have Better Things to Do Than Join ISIS
headline.print_headline: Muslims Reply to ISIS Offer: Sorry, We’re Busy

snippet: Play video games, see “Star Wars,” wash the dishes: Muslims respond to the Islamic State leader’s rallying cry with defiance, opposition and sarcasm.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
